TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1095-1096

barker_notes.barker_summary: Deposition of Wm. Pryor concerning a stolen slave, May 16, 1825.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: Nacogdoches Archives, Texas State Library. The Spanish original is also in the
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1095-1096

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Deposition of Wm. Pryor concerning a stolen slave, May 16, 1825.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Department of Texas*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*District of San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned**/p* *p*Before me *person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin Judge*/person_mentioned* of the *location_mentioned*Colony on the Brazos River*/location_mentioned* in said Department personally apeared *person_mentioned*William Pryor*/person_mentioned* who was summoned at the request of *person_mentioned*Leonard Duboys*/person_mentioned* to give testimony relative to the *person_mentioned*Negro Gabriel*/person_mentioned* and said *person_mentioned*Pryor*/person_mentioned* being duly sworn, deposeth and sayeth, that some time in the month of *date_mentioned n="01-xx-1825">January last*/date_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Nicholas Trammel*/person_mentioned* was at *person_mentioned*deponents */person_mentioned*house on the *location_mentioned*Brazos River*/location_mentioned* near this place and at that time the said *person_mentioned*Trammel*/person_mentioned* told this Deponent that the *person_mentioned*Negro */person_mentioned*called *person_mentioned*Gabriel */person_mentioned*who was in dispute between him said *person_mentioned*Trammel*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Maria Louise Veillon*/person_mentioned* at *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned*was then in his said *person_mentioned*Trammel*/person_mentioned*'s possession and was at his *location_mentioned*House */location_mentioned*on the *location_mentioned*Angelina*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*Deponent further saieth that he has never seen said *person_mentioned*Negro */person_mentioned*since he saw him in *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned*at the time of the Law suit with said *person_mentioned*Maria Louisa Veillon*/person_mentioned* relative to said *person_mentioned*Negro*/person_mentioned*, and never heard that he was brought to this *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*by any person.*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="05-16-1825">16th May 1825*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Wm Pryor*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Sworn and subscribed to before me*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin [Rubric] Judge*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*Witness*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Samuel M Williams Secy*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
